org.tms.api.utils

Interface TableCellValidator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TableCellTransformer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CellValueTransformer, NumericRange, NumericRangeRequired
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface TableCellValidator
extends Serializable
    Classes that implement TableCellValidator can validate perspective cell values before they are persisted in Table Cells. Uses include verifying that numeric values fall within an allowable range, preventing invalid or undesired values from being set, etc.

    Because TableCellValidator is a FunctionalInterface, a lambda expression (closure) can be used in place of a class instance in calls to TableRowColumnElement.setValidator() or Cell.setValidator().

    Since:
    "1.0"
    Version:
    "1.1"
    See Also:
    Cell.setValidator(TableCellValidator), TableRowColumnElement.setValidator(TableCellValidator)

    • Method Detail

      • fromGroovy

        static TableCellValidator fromGroovy(String fileName)
        Create and return a TableCellValidator based on a Groovy implementation. The contained Groovy class is inspected for a method that matches the signature of validate(Object) and uses it to perform cell value validation.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name of the Groovy script
        Returns:
        a {code TableCellValidator} based on a Groovy implementation

      • fromGroovy

        static TableCellValidator fromGroovy(String fileName,
                                     String valName,
                                     String transName)
        Create and return a TableCellValidator based on a Groovy implementation. Methods for both cell value validation as well as transformation can be specified.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name of the Groovy script
        valName - method name of the cell validator
        transName - method name of the cell transformer
        Returns:
        a {code TableCellTransformer} based on a Groovy implementation

      • validate

        void validate(Object newValue)
       throws ConstraintViolationException
        Validates the candidate cell value according to the rules coded in the implementing method.
        Parameters:
        newValue - the candidate cell value to validate
        Throws:
        ConstraintViolationException - if the candidate value doesn't conform to the constraints defined in validate.

      • transform

        default Object transform(Object newValue)
                  throws ConstraintViolationException
        Validate and transform the candidate cell value according to the rules coded in the implementing method. If the candidate cell value passes the validation criteria, it can also be transformed by the implementing method to apply application-specific formating and data consistency rules.

        Note that as the TableCellValidator contract requires that implementing classes supply a validate method, classes that override transform may choose to implement all validation logic in validate and simply invoke that method within.

        Parameters:
        newValue - the candidate cell value to validate and transform
        Returns:
        the validated and transformed candidate cell value
        Throws:
        ConstraintViolationException - ConstraintViolationException if the candidate value doesn't conform to the constraints.
        See Also:
        Cell.setValidator(TableCellValidator), TableRowColumnElement.setValidator(TableCellValidator)
